Boards & Commissions

The Town of Double Oak is comprised of the Board of Adjustments, and Planning & Zone Commission.

Application and Reappointment Application for Boards & Commissions

Board of Adjustments

About us:

The Board of Adjustment hears requests for variances from the comprehensive zoning ordinance, and from other ordinances, as specified in the town’s Code. This is an actionable appeal board, and decisions by this board cannot be overturned by Town Council, but only in County Court.

Meetings:

This Board meets on an as-needed basis only. 

Members:

11 members serve staggered 2-year terms, with five designated as voting members, and six alternates. 

Name Position Term Expires
Marty RobbinsCo-Chair09/2027
Karen SmithMember09/2026
Dirk MeilingerMember09/2027
Sam RogersMember09/2027
Kennon MoffittMember09/2026
AlternateVacant
AlternateVacant
AlternateVacant

Planning & Zoning Commission

About us:

The Planning and Zoning Commission develops and revises town zoning ordinances and addresses other items at the request of Town Council. This is a working body that recommends decisions to the Town Council for action.

Members:

Seven members serve staggered 2-year terms, voting on decisions, and there are four alternates. 

Name Position Term Expires
Andrew WeaverChairman09-2027
Gary GoodmanVice Chairman09-2027
Donna GilliamMember09-2026
Bonnie MorrowMember09-2026
Edward MehlhaffMember09-2027
Dan McCormickMember09-2027
Cassandra ShimpMember09-2026
Dave JohnsonAlternate09-2026
